main event: On November 17, 1955, in St. Louis, Missouri, a civilian observed three silver-colored objects flying in formation, then disappearing over the horizon in the northeast within a 25-second period. The conclusion was that there was insufficient data for evaluation and the course of the objects was unidentified.
interesting points: The objects were described as silver-colored and flying in formation before disappearing over the horizon.
There were three objects observed, and it was noted that there was no vibration or signs of type of power units observed.
The angle of elevation was 75 degrees, with the azimuth being northeast.
The observer suggested a possible cause of the sighting to be a new type of aircraft in formation.
